context: Located approximately <b5_0>250 kilometres<b5_0/> (<a0_0><b6_0>160<a0_0/> mi<b6_0/>) east of Puerto Rico and the nearer Virgin Islands, St. Barthélemy lies immediately <b7_0>southeast<b7_0/> of the islands of Saint Martin and Anguilla. It is one of <a1_0>the Renaissance<a1_0/> Islands. St. Barthélemy is separated from Saint Martin by <a2_0>the Saint-Barthélemy Channel<a2_0/>. It lies <b8_0>northeast<b8_0/> of Saba and St Eustatius, and north of St Kitts. Some small <a3_0>satellite islets<a3_0/> belong to St. Barthélemy including Île Chevreau (Île Bonhomme), Île Frégate, Île Toc Vers, Île Tortue and Gros Îlets (Îlots Syndare). A much bigger islet, Île Fourchue, lies on the <b9_0>north<b9_0/> of the island, in the Saint-Barthélemy Channel. Other rocky islets which include Coco, the Roques (or <a4_0>little Turtle rocks<a4_0/>), the Goat, and the Sugarloaf.
